issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

comments.body:
hello [~redarccoder] it looks like you have an old Alloy version, can you please update your whole environment and try again? If the issue continue, please attach full logs, ti config, ti info and a test case with steps to reproduce the issue.

Best

I updated all the IDE before posting the bug:
Titanium Studio: 3.4.1.201410281727
Alloy Version: 1.6
CLI Version: 4.0
SDK Version: 3.5.1.GA, 3.5.0 GA, AND 4.0.1.v20150521135010

Log File:

And After I try to build th eproject:

{color:#14892c}!ENTRY com.appcelerator.titanium.core 4 0 2015-05-23 09:38:47.578
!MESSAGE (Build 3.4.1.201410281727) [ERROR] The requested SDK version does not have an assigned commands-handler Error cleaning the project{color}

Also, the steps to reproduce the issue are:
1.- Create an alloy project
2.- try to run it

Well, seems like the new App celerator studio kicked in in time, and it can compile and run Alloy projects, mark this as solved

Thanx for your help (and also sorry for my bad english)
